metadata.Title: CVE-2014-9770 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
tmpfiles.d/systemd.conf in systemd before 214 uses weak permissions for journal files under (1) /run/log/journal/%m and (2) /var/log/journal/%m, which allows local users to obtain sensitive information by reading these files.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-9770` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-gudev-1.0 - 204-5ubuntu20.19
libgudev-1.0-0 - 204-5ubuntu20.19
No subscription required

libpam-systemd - 204-5ubuntu20.19
libsystemd-daemon0 - 204-5ubuntu20.19
libsystemd-id128-0 - 204-5ubuntu20.19
libsystemd-journal0 - 204-5ubuntu20.19
libsystemd-login0 - 204-5ubuntu20.19
libudev1 - 204-5ubuntu20.19
python-systemd - 204-5ubuntu20.19
systemd-services - 204-5ubuntu20.19
udev - 204-5ubuntu20.19
No subscription required

criterions.comment: systemd package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '204-5ubuntu20.19').
systemd package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '204-5ubuntu20.19').
